means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 特里克绰号，狡猾的人，来源于中世纪英语，含义是“计谋”(stratagem,device)

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含有"欺骗"之意。
means: cheat ： 普通用词，指用蒙蔽他人的手段取得所需之物，尤多指在赢利的买卖中欺骗人。
deceive ： 最普通用词，指用虚假外表使人信以为真，或蓄意歪曲事实，或造成错误印象使人上当受骗。
trick ： 指用阴谋诡计等骗得信任或得到所需之物。
fool ： 指把别人当傻瓜，愚弄欺骗别人。

sentence.Network_en: I don't think Mr Cavanagh would get far with that trick.
sentence.Network_cn: 我想卡瓦纳先生的那套把戏玩不了多久。

sentence.Network_en: She is the victim of a big con trick.
sentence.Network_cn: 她是一场大骗局的受害者。

sentence.Network_en: Love songs trick us into believing in knights in shining armor.
sentence.Network_cn: 情歌哄骗我们去相信有勇救美人的英雄。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)every available method of achieving what one wants
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)（达到目的的）各种可能方法
(非正式)你好吗（表示友善的问候语）

lj.lj_ly: ‘How's tricks in your neck of the woods?’.

phrase.cizu_name: the oldest trick in the book

jx.jx_en_mean: a ruse so hackneyed that it should no longer deceive anyone
jx.jx_cn_mean: 书中的老把戏（非常过时，无法再骗人）

jx.jx_en_mean: (chiefly N. Amer.)a children's custom of calling at houses at Halloween with the threat of pranks if they are not given a small gift (often used as a greeting by children doing this)
jx.jx_cn_mean: (主北美)招待还是捣蛋（万圣节时，孩子们上门索要小礼物，否则就搞恶作剧的风俗，常用作孩子们万圣节上门时的问候语）

jx.jx_en_mean: special ingenious techniques used in a profession or craft, especially those that are little known by outsiders
jx.jx_cn_mean: （尤指外行很少懂的）行业秘诀

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)(of a prostitute) have a session with a client
(一般作 be tricked out)dress or decorate someone or something in an elaborate or showy way
jx.jx_cn_mean: 盛装打扮某人；隆重装饰某物

lj.lj_ly: a Marine &B{tricked out in} World War II kit and weaponry.
lj.lj_ls: 一个披挂着二战装备和武器的水兵。

phrase.cizu_name: trick out  或 trick up 【非正式用语】

jx.jx_en_mean: To ornament or adorn, often garishly
jx.jx_cn_mean: 装扮，打扮：装饰或修饰，通常是华美地，耀眼地

lj.lj_ly: was all tricked out in beads and fringe.
lj.lj_ls: 用小珠子和花边装饰起来

jx.jx_en_mean: To bring about the desired result.

phrase.cizu_name: do the trick 或 turn the trick

jx.jx_en_mean: Used to make a friendly inquiry about a person or that person's affairs.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 怎么样：用来友好地询问某人的情况或事务

lj.lj_ly: The teacher was known for not missing a trick.
lj.lj_ls: 这个老师警惕性很高是众所周知

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (as a noun): from an Old French dialect variant of triche, from trichier 'deceive', of unknown origin. Current senses of the verb date from the mid 16th cent

encyclopedia.content: 解释 1. 诡计；骗局；谋略；花招 He got into the castle by a trick. 他耍了个花招混进了城堡。 2. 恶作剧 3. 轻率愚蠢的行为 That was a rotten trick! 那样做太轻率了！ 4. 习惯，癖好[(+of)] He has a trick of repeating himself. 他有重复自己话的习惯。 5. 窍门,招数，手法 Daily practice is the trick in learning a foreign language. 每天练习是学会一门外语的诀窍。 6. 戏法，把戏;特技，妙计 No one understood how

entry.def: A trick is an action that is intended to deceive someone.

example.ex: We are playing a trick on a man who keeps bothering me.
example.tran: 我们正在戏弄那个一直烦我的家伙。

entry.def: If someone tricks you, they deceive you, often in order to make you do something.

example.ex: Stephen is going to be pretty upset when he finds out how you tricked him...
example.tran: 如果斯蒂芬发现你怎样欺骗了他，他会非常气愤。

example.ex: His family tricked him into going to Pakistan, and once he was there, they took away his passport...
example.tran: 家人骗他去了巴基斯坦，等到他一到那里，他们就拿走了他的护照。

entry.def: A trick is a clever or skilful action that someone does in order to entertain people.

example.tran: 他表演纸牌戏法给我看。

entry.def: A trick is a clever way of doing something.

example.ex: Tiffany revamped her sitting room with simple decorative tricks.
example.tran: 蒂法尼采用简单的装饰技巧将起居室翻新。

example.ex: It is not just a little trick you can pick up in half an hour.
example.tran: 这不是你半个小时就能学会的小窍门。

entry.def: If something does the trick, it achieves what you wanted.

example.ex: Sometimes a few choice words will do the trick.
example.tran: 有时说几句尖酸刻薄的话就有人听了。

entry.tran: 千方百计;浑身解数;所有的办法
entry.def: If someone tries every trick in the book, they try every possible thing that they can think of in order to achieve something.

example.ex: Companies are using every trick in the book to stay one step in front of their competitors.
example.tran: 各公司想方设法地保持比竞争者领先一步的优势。

entry.def: If you say that something is a trick of the light, you mean that what you are seeing is an effect caused by the way that the light falls on things, and does not really exist in the way that it appears.

example.ex: Her head appears to be on fire but that is only a trick of the light.
example.tran: 她的头部看上去像是着火了，但那只是灯光造成的幻觉。

entry.tran: 无所(不)知;无事(不)晓;把握住任何机会
entry.def: If you say that someone does not miss a trick, you mean that they always know what is happening and take advantage of every situation.

example.ex: When it comes to integrating their transport systems, the French don't miss a trick.
example.tran: 法国人从不放过任何整合其交通系统的机会。

entry.def: The tricks of the trade are the quick and clever ways of doing something that are known by people who regularly do a particular activity.

example.ex: To get you started, we have asked five successful writers to reveal some of the tricks of the trade.
example.tran: 为了让你开始写作，我们邀请了 5 位成功作家向你透露一些写作秘诀。

entry.def: If you say that someone is up to their tricks or up to their old tricks, you disapprove of them because they are behaving in the dishonest or deceitful way in which they typically behave.

example.ex: I have no respect for my father who, having remarried, is still up to his old tricks.
example.tran: 我对父亲没任何敬意，他已经再婚，却依然喜欢耍老把戏。

means.word_mean: 1. a cunning or deceitful action or device;

sentences.sentence: "he pulled a fast one and got away with it"

means.word_mean: 2. a period of work or duty
3. an attempt to get you to do something foolish or imprudent;
4. a ludicrous or grotesque act done for fun and amusement
5. an illusory feat; considered magical by naive observers

sentences.sentence: "We tricked the teacher into thinking that class would be cancelled next week"

auth_sentence.content: Will Home Before Dark do the trick this time?
auth_sentence.res_content: Will Home Before Dark do the trick this time?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Will Home Before Dark do the trick this time?

auth_sentence.content: The trick is knowing how to tap into them.
auth_sentence.res_content: The trick is knowing how to tap into them.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The trick is knowing how to tap into them.

auth_sentence.content: Thankfully, Spacey pulls off this trick with aplomb.
auth_sentence.res_content: Thankfully, Spacey pulls off this trick with aplomb.

Sentence.sentence: These findings echo earlier research that suggests our perception of food can sometimes trick our body's response to the food itself.
Although it hardly seems practical to trick ourselves into eating less

sentences.en: An old dog cannot learn new tricks.

means.word_mean: 计谋, 诡计, 花招

sentences.en: Don't be fooled by any of her cunning tricks.
sentences.cn: 不要被她的任何诡计所骗。

sentences.en: He even plays a shabby trick on his father.
sentences.cn: 他甚至同他的父亲玩弄卑鄙的手段。

sentences.en: I thought I saw a ghost, but perhaps it was only a trick of the light.
sentences.cn: 我以为我看见鬼了, 但这大概不过是灯光在捉弄人。

means.word_mean: 诀窍, 技巧, 技艺

sentences.en: Patience is the trick in doing a job well.
A clever lawyer should be able to trick the prisoner into an admission of guilt.
sentences.cn: 聪明的律师应能诱使罪犯认罪。

sentences.en: She tricked herself out for the party.
sentences.cn: 她把自己打扮起来去参加晚会。

sentences.en: Trick photography is one of his hobbies.
sentences.cn: 特技摄影是他的爱好之一。

sentences.en: It was purely a trick question.
sentences.cn: 这纯粹是一个有意捉弄人的问题。

jushi.english: How many tricks did we lsoe?
He grew suspicious of that trick.
jushi.chinese: 他对那个把戏起了疑心。

jushi.english: Don't be fooled by any of her cunning tricks.
jushi.chinese: 不要被她的任何诡计所骗。
